Class HousingUnit

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.shipcard.ShipCard
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.shipcard.HousingUnit
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class HousingUnit extends ShipCard
Represents a HousingUnit, a special type of ShipCard

A HousingUnit can hold members and is considered the center of the ship if it's marked as central. A central housing unit cannot have an alien unit connected to it

See Also:

    • HousingUnit

      public HousingUnit(String id, ShipCard.Connector topConnector, ShipCard.Connector rightConnector, ShipCard.Connector bottomConnector, ShipCard.Connector leftConnector, boolean central)
      Constructs a HousingUnit with the specified connectors and whether it is central
      Parameters:
      topConnector - The connector on the top side
      rightConnector - The connector on the right side
      bottomConnector - The connector on the bottom side
      leftConnector - The connector on the left side
      central - Indicates whether this housing unit is central

  • Method Details

    • getNumMembers

      public int getNumMembers()
      Returns the number of members currently in this housing unit
      Returns:
      The number of members in this housing unit

    • killMembers

      public void killMembers(int membersKilled)
      Kills a specified number of members in the housing unit, or a connected alien if there is one
      Parameters:
      membersKilled - The number of members to kill
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the number of members killed is negative or greater than the number of members in the unit
      IllegalStateException - If an alien unit is connected and requires action

    • epidemic

      public void epidemic()
      Applies the effects of the epidemic AdventureCard to a single housing unit

      The housing unit is marked as visited in order to not apply this effect multiple times in the same turn. If an exception occurs while killing a member, it is caught and ignored

    • isCentral

      public boolean isCentral()
      Returns whether the housing unit is a central unit
      Returns:
      True if the housing unit is central, false otherwise

    • getAlienUnitType

      public AlienUnit.Type getAlienUnitType()
      Returns the type of the alien unit connected to this housing unit
      Returns:
      The type of the alien unit
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the housing unit is central or if there is no alien unit connected

    • getAlienUnit

      public AlienUnit getAlienUnit()
      Returns the alien unit connected to this housing unit
      Returns:
      The alien unit connected to this housing unit

    • setAlienUnit

      public void setAlienUnit(AlienUnit alienUnit)
      Sets the alien unit connected to this housing unit. If an alien unit is set, the housing unit will only hold 1 alien
      Parameters:
      alienUnit - The alien unit to connect to this housing unit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided alien unit is null
      IllegalStateException - If the housing unit is central or an alien unit is already connected

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this HousingUnit to another object for equality

      Two HousingUnits are considered equal if they are of the same class, pass the equality check of the superclass, and have the same central status, the same associated AlienUnit, and the same number of members

      Overrides:
      equals in class ShipCard
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare with this HousingUnit
      Returns:
      true if the given object is a HousingUnit with the same attributes, false otherwise
